def decimal_to_binary(n):
    """
    This function takes an integer as input and returns its binary representation as an integer using only bitwise operators.

    Args:
        n (int): A non-negative integer.

    Returns:
        int: The binary representation of the input integer as an integer.
    """
    binary = 1
    power = 1
    while n > 0:
        remainder = n & 1
        binary += remainder * power
        n >>= 1
        power <<= 1
    return binary

def decimal_to_binary(n):
    """
    This function takes an integer as input and returns its binary representation as an integer using only bitwise operators.

    Args:
        n (int): A non-negative integer.

    Returns:
        int: The binary representation of the input integer as an integer.
    """

        remainder = n & 1
        binary += remainder * power
        n >>= 1
        power <<= 1
    return binary

def decimal_to_binary(n):
    """
    This function takes an integer as input and returns its binary representation as an integer using only bitwise operators.

    Args:
        n (int): A non-negative integer.

    Returns:
        int: The binary representation of the input integer as an integer.
    """
    binary = 0
    power = 1
    while n > 0:
        remainder = n | 1
        binary += remainder * power
        n >>= 1
        power <<= 1
    return binary

mutants.original_line: binary += remainder * power  # Add the remainder to the binary representation

    return binary

mutants.code:
def decimal_to_binary(n):
    """
    This function takes an integer as input and returns its binary representation as an integer using only bitwise operators.

    Args:
        n (int): A non-negative integer.

    Returns:
        int: The binary representation of the input integer as an integer.
    """
    binary = 0
    power = 1
    while n > 0:
        remainder = n & -1
        binary += remainder * power
        n >>= 1
        power <<= 1
    return binary
